document.name: dark

sentence.text: As we sink into our own ruins , the dark horse rides on America !
It has a light side MYAMP amp ; a dark side , and it holds the universe together .

In this he is in the dark company of most members of the Russian Duma and provincial legislatures , a generation of former Soviet officials thrown into democratic forums for which they have no instinct and little respect .

My own obscure favorites include the first books of Honor Tracy ( Irish-born satirist who makes Evelyn Waugh 's work taste like the milk of human kindness ) , the dark early writing of Sigrid Undset ( before her religious conversion , which radically changed her style ) , and the best novels of manners by John Marquand -- all of which are largely unknown to contemporary readers ( particularly young ones ) .

Here was a man who whispered terrible , dark things about himself under his breath .
A dark , mysterious voice answered him .

It came in through my mother 's blood ; my Russian grandmother would always tell me stories , bylichkas , of ancestors with the `` second sight '' , stupid mill owners who discovered bags of gold after letting a special fish off their hooks , and dark strangers who used to appear to help or interfere at crucial times .
Spencer 's magnificent self-portrait of 1914 , dark and mysterious as a Rembrandt , was snatched up by an important London collector .
